soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kiatuturu cu. musikarʉ takituturua. makasi pan-cang: “aratakaraa! musu’ʉvʉ!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我今天七點到學校。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: masitatia kim makasi: “manʉng takituturua!”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好！」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa kiatuturu, tumatuturu kimia takituturua sʉpʉrʉ tamna kari.
In class, the teacher taught us the Kanakanavu language of numbers.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tuapapa kim sumasʉpʉrʉ. paracani kim sʉpʉrʉ tamna cani.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: takutavara’ʉ ku ’itumuru kari Kanakanavu.
I have learned many Kanakanavu languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tantaniara ku mukusa tarisinata. tantaniara kiatuturu kari Kanakanavu. tia ku ’apatimana cina.
I go to school every day, I learn the Kanakanavu language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: sua nganai maku ia Mu’u.
My name is Mu’u.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的名字是Mu’u。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nganai cuma maku ia ’Una.
My dad’s name is ’Una.
我今天七點到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是’Una。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nganai cina maku ia Paicʉ.
My mother’s name is Paicʉ.
我今天七點到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Paicʉ。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: cenana isi. maan cenana ku.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’una ku tacini kana’ua sarunai, Pori kisʉʉn. cenana isi maan cani cenana sua nguain.
I have a brother, his name is Pori, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Pori。他今年11歲。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi kim matʉa tarisinata marisinatʉ.
We study in the same school.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: iku mataa kana’ua sarunai manmaan kim paracani.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: manmaan ku makananguru, noo tarasangara taniara, cani pininga kim arakukunu arapiningi makananguru.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: manmaan ku tarakanangʉ vo’orua tangria, tʉni kim arakukunu paracani mataa makananguru.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: sua iku ia manu Kanakanavu.
I am an Kanakanavu child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我是卡那卡那富族的小孩。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi Namasia sua tanasa mia.
Our family lives in Namasia.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家住在那瑪夏。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: rarima kim cani pininga.
There are five people in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: taturu kim kinvavara.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’utumʉkʉnʉ ku mataa cuma, cina, kana’ua sarunai, kana’ua nanakʉ.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marʉngʉcai cuma maku. kesacu sua cuma maku.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很高。我的爸爸是警察。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ta’uici cina maku. ’iseeng sua cina maku.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦。我的媽媽是醫生。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: masiKanakanavu cuma maku na tanasa.
My father speaks the Kanakanavu language with us at home.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tarasangara kana’ʉcana paira kim pui’i tanasʉn.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: arakukunu ku mataa kana’ua nanakʉ matisa’ʉ takarura.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: manmaan ku cani pininga maku.
I like our family very much.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: soni arapiningi ku mataa cina sumasima’ʉ.
I went out with my mother today.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ca’ania mangiri taniara. ka’anʉ makungu, ka’anʉ macici. maparipi pariapara.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我今天七點到學校。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi kim racʉcʉnʉa kumakʉnʉ mien-pau. pariʉn taniarʉ, cucuru ma’avu.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包。陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nuca’ania, niaramasinang cu kakangca.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kesoniʉn maku cina, neni vanai masinang sua kakangca?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi cina, manasʉ ’una raru tia iavatu.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我今天七點到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: rovana, ’akia ʉcʉ na kakangca. arapiningi tamtasai.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲。星星出來了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tia cu kim pui’i tanasa.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: na pui’i tanasa cacanʉ, masikusa ku na tamtasai parasingsing.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kamʉcʉ ka’anʉ iavatu raru, tia pa kim arapiningi sumasima’ʉ.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我今天七點到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tarisinata maku ’esi na ciciri tanasa mia. tantaniara ku mucaca mukusa tarisinata. mucaca pui’i tanasa.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊。我天天走路去學校。也走路回家。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ka’anʉ tatia tarisinata mia. ka’anʉ kacaua seto. patarakanangʉ kim.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們學校不大。沒有很多學生。大家互相認識。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kavangvang mamanu paira arakukunu na tarapana’ʉa. kamamari, parʉ’ʉna.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
我今天七點到學校。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場。一起玩球、一起聊天。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: takituturua iavatu kangvang arakukunu kimia sumasima’ʉ. tarisinata makai tatia cani pininga.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
我今天七點到學校。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩。學校是個大家庭。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tantaniara kim tia marisiki. pasa’ʉcaiʉn mia ’aravang tarisinata.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們每天都要打掃。大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’una cau mururu tasinʉva, ’una cau marisiki.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我今天七點到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marisiki pa kim cikiringa tarisinata. pasovungu kim putukioa. tantaniara sua tarisinata masa’ʉcai.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落。大家分工合作。學校每天都很乾淨。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miʉra, nimukusa ku tanasʉn rovʉvʉ na tamu.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaranau cu kim koo ’arupacʉ’ʉra. pacʉpʉngʉ ku ’inia.
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: cumacʉ’ʉra ’ikua tamu, makacang ’apakʉnʉ ’ikua vakatʉ, ’apima nangira.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: matavi’isi nimʉkʉa tamu vakatʉ, cucuru sa’o’o!
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃！

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: manmaan ku kangvang tamu tamna nangira, manʉng imʉʉn.
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa vʉcʉkai ca’ania, takacocua ku mataa tamu nanakʉ po’ucipi tia kuca’ania.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我今天七點到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: macakuarʉ nipo’ucipia tamu nanakʉ. ’una vutukuru, tarukuka, tangtang mataa pʉrʉkʉ karavung.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐。有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nikuca’ania cu, mukusa kim tanatʉngʉa mara tatʉngʉ.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nimara tamu nanakʉ ’itumuru tammi, tanʉkʉ mataa cʉngaa, ’apavici ’ikua mutanasa.
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: musu’ʉvʉ ku nguani, makasi ’arupacʉ’ʉra pai!
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們！

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: soni marivici kimia takituturua mukusa tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ. matavʉnʉrʉ kim na ta’aravanga pu’a kipu.
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天老師帶我們去動物園。我們在門口排隊買票。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: musikarʉ na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ. makasi takituturua, “tu’urua ia tapinange, kukuca ia vunai. takacicinia cumacʉ’ʉra.”
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
我今天七點到學校。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35581/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ma’icʉpʉ ku vunai. imua ka’anʉ ku cumacʉ’ʉra vunai.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我今天七點到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: cumacʉ’ʉra ku ’itumuru tapinange. ’esi na karu mingangane. ’una pa puka na tarako karu si’icʉpʉ.
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
我今天七點到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ, ’una ta-siang, ’uma mataa rau-hu. miana koo pa ku cinimʉ’ʉra marʉkurapʉ isi. campe soni cumacʉ’ʉra, cucuru macangcangarʉ.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我今天七點到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了，真的很開心。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: patara’aningu ku ’itumuru siasing, ’apacʉ’ʉra cuma cina.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: maka’ʉna tia ku arakukunu cuma cina iavatu nesi.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tarasangara isi, iku mataa kana’ua mukusa Taitung rovʉvʉ na cuma vuravurau.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: aranai kim Taipe tukisia mukusa Taitung.
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makacʉkʉna Taitung, cuma vuravurau ’unting kuruma iavatu tatuparaa kisia matʉnʉsʉ kimia.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我今天七點到學校。: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tatuparaa kisia ka’anʉ araceni tanasa cuma vuravurau, ’unting kuruma makacang makacʉkʉna.
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
我今天七點到學校。: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: capici cuma vuravurau tamna tanasa, ’una ’inia tatia tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkurapʉ. tutanpu kim mukusa ’inia.
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家附近，有個很大的牧場。我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi na tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkurapʉ. marivici kimia cuma vuravurau ’apakʉnʉ takuisi mataa tupara ’uma.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我今天七點到學校。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: rovana, arakukunu kim mukusa tumʉra kumakʉnʉ.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’itumuru kuruma na tumʉra, imua tu’utupai kim mukusa ’inia.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我今天七點到學校。: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa tia cu muca, niko’ua ’utupai mia. ’inmamia cu tupasu aratʉkʉnʉ.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我今天七點到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了。我們只好搭公車離開。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: masini, pui’i cu kim na Taipe. nimʉtʉa cu kara cuma vuravurau tamna ’utupai?
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了。不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有？

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa tati’ingi pa, ’esi kim na Namasia. marisinatʉ cu, aravari na Kaosiung. makasua monoon cu na tumʉra.
When we were young, our family lived in Namasia. After I started school, we moved to Kaohsiung and have been living in the city ever since.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我們家住在那瑪夏，上學以後，就搬到了高雄，一直在都市裡生活。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marisinatʉ na ta-sie. kiatuturu ku poisua Yencumin tamna mungka. takutavara’ʉ Taiwan Yencu mincu ’una macakuarʉ mungka.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: imua, cenana isi tarasangara kana’ʉcana. maracocua ku mataa kana’ua pui’i na tanasʉn kesoni mamarang. poisua takacicini cuku tamna mungka.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: maruun cu cenana mamarang, nakai makai pa kakana’ua nanmarua.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kesoniʉn maku, neneni kari tavara’ʉa in? saihu nguain masiKanakanavu, tavara’ʉ pa masiSumukun, masiRipun.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Kanakanavu, as well as Bunun and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言？他的卡那卡那富語說得很流利，也會說布農語和日本話。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kesoniʉn maku, imuava miaa tati’ingi pa. kiatuturu kari Ripun. ’ucangʉ in ia Bunun, imua ’itumuru tavara’ʉa in kari.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tumatuturu kimia ’itumuru poisua aracakanʉ tamna macʉrang.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’apaco’e ka’anʉ kim akanangʉn kavangvang, nakai ’urupacʉʉn mia ramucu tangsua mapusikarʉ ’aningu, tavara’ʉn pa maka’ʉna tumatimana.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa tati’ingi, ka’anʉ tavara’ʉ takacicini tamna mungka. maraini tumatuturu sua iku ia Cau Vuvurung.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’itumru cu tavara’ʉa. cucuruava tukupecu sua Kanakanavu, purangrang cʉpʉngʉ.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Kanakanavu is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為卡那卡那富人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: rovana soni, tia cu pui’i kanarua sarunai.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: maracocua ku mataa tamu mukusa tamia’aa pu’a tarukuka, rovana tia kim mati’arangʉ sa’o’o kʉnʉa ’apakʉnʉ kanarua.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: maica kim na tamia’aa, ’itumuru mata’ʉ natʉngʉ.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nipu’a kim tarako natʉngʉ, vakure mataa cepo.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ciciri ’inia rau-pan makasi, “matavi’isi pangtan mataa mamiki maku, tanamaan pu’a ti’ingi.”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nipa’a kim pangtan mataa mamiki.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: maica kim na tamia’aa ’aramʉ. makasi rau-pan, “neni tia pu’aa musu? tarukuka soni, tatia, ma’angirisi. ucani turu mʉna.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: rangrang misee tamu. kesoni na rau-pan, tʉni kara yasui ti’ingi?
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nakai makasi rau-pan, yasui cu misee, ka’anʉ cu tʉni mana’ʉ.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: akini ’inia rau-pan makasi, ivataa pu’a vutukuru maku. vutukuru maku tatia mataa yasui misee.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marivivini, nipu’a kim tarukuka mataa vutukuru, pui’i tanasa po’ucipi kim cani pangka camai.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaranau maritarʉ. mapitʉ’ʉ cu kakangca.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: paritangsua kanarua sarunai makasi, surumu hetai ka’anʉ tarasangai. tia kani maka’ʉna tarasangara pui’i misee.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi tamu, macakuarʉ cu nipo’ucipia. pukario kavangvang ’apivatu kumʉkʉnʉ!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: pokariʉn mia kacaua kincaua, kunganganʉ macakuarʉ rovana.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’una ku tacini kʉkʉnang marisinatʉ Pa’ʉ kisʉʉn, paira nguain roimi marivici nonoman.
I have a classmate named Pa’ʉ, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Pa’ʉ，他常常忘記帶東西。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: noo tia cu marisinatʉ, sumasuruvai na cucumeni siarisinatʉ, sia’ucu’ucu nukai tapasinatʉ.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makaan, makacusa, makaturu, ’apasuruvaiʉn cau.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nakai, ’una nguain aka niurina. paira sumasuruvai ka’anʉ mai’i.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marivivini, ka’anʉ cu cau ’apasuruvai ’inia nonoman.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’una cani taniara. arakukunu kim mutaira sumasima’ʉ.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: na cacanʉ, tia muta’i sua Pa’ʉ. nakai niroimi nguain marivici cirikami.
On the way, Pa’ʉ wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，Pa’ʉ想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: sumasuruvai nguain na kʉkʉnang, nakai arivariʉn kavangvang makasi, koo ku kangvang marivici cirikami.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: mamumʉkʉ cu Pa’ʉ. arakuracʉ makasi, miseni kamu ka’anʉ ’apasuruvai ’ikua cirikami?
Pa’ʉ burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: Pa’ʉ急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙？

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tuturuʉn kʉkʉnang, vanai sii ka’anʉ kasu takacicini marivici. mataa sumasuruvai kasu nonoman, ka’anʉ mai’i.
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: akini taniara. mucʉmcʉm Pa’ʉ mukusa tarisinata. siniruvai nonoman ai’iʉn kee na kʉkʉnang.
The next day at school, Pa’ʉ arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，Pa’ʉ很早就到學校了，Pa’ʉ把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: musu’ʉvʉ Pa’ʉ na kʉkʉnang. makasi, no’unaan tia kani takacicini marivici nonoman. sosomanpe misee na kʉkʉnang, me’inaan nipasuruvai ’inia nonoman.
Pa’ʉ apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: Pa’ʉ向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: sua cuma maku ia cau aracakanʉ.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa tati’ingi pa ku. cuma mataa cuma vuravurau arapipiningi noo rovana. sikinumanʉ marivici nantu.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: araciasʉ, marivici cu nguani niaracakana pui’i.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’apanapa vavuru, rarʉ, ’apanapa ’una tivukarʉ.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esi na taira, sovunguʉn cu nguani ’aramʉ.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: paira ku makari cuma, tia kipapa ’inia aracakanʉ.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi cuma, noo aratatia cu ku, tia kani marivici ’ikua.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: tanasʉn sasarunai, rumaringai nukai kamanʉngʉ tarʉnʉ matisa’ʉ marʉkurapʉ.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: saihu cuma maku cumacipi. makasi, sua isi ia siaripaca matisa’ʉ tivukarʉ. tia cumacʉ’ʉra ’anuka nipaicaa. musʉ’ʉ ’inia sua cipi.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: vanai tia kipapa kakana’ua aracakanʉ. tantaniara ku rinsiu kamanʉngʉ ringai. makacang, tʉni cu ringai maku matisa’ʉ marʉkurapʉ.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: cumacʉ’ʉra cuma maku makasi, nuari tia mintasʉ kasu aracakanʉ.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: masini tatia cu ku. ariviciʉ maku rupacʉ, vuru. kipapa cuma aracakanʉ.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: pui’i tanasʉn sovunguʉn niaracakana movua kincaucaua.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi cuma, tia kita musu’ʉvʉ tamutamua, movua tikata macakuarʉ marʉkurapʉ.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’apaca’ivi takananga ku totasiarʉ.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa mukusa tarisinata, niroimi ku marivici kapaang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: koo ku marivici avara’e nonoman.
I didn’t bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa kiatuturu, arakukunu ku kʉkʉnang cumacʉ’ʉra sinatʉ.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa sikingi, ’apasuruvai ’ikua kʉkʉnang siarisinatʉ mataa sia’ucu’ucu.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi ’ikua takituturua, “no’unaan mucʉmcʉmʉa aramia’ʉ, ’akuni cu ’apaca’ivi takananga!”
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: sua tangria maku Pani, Kanakanavu tamna manu kangvang sua nguain.
My good friend’s name is Pani, and he is also an Kanakanavu child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Pani，他也是卡那卡那富族的小孩。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: arakukunu kim na Namasia marisinatʉ.
We study together in the Namasia tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在那瑪夏部落讀書。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: paira kim arakukunu tumatimana mamarang po’ʉ’ʉna.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Kanakanavu proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說卡那卡那富語。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: marʉngʉcai ku mataa ciuman kangvang. manʉkʉpai mataa ta’uici sua Pani.
I am tall and overweight, while Pani is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Pani很矮也很瘦。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ma’intasʉ sua Pani, manmaan kavangvnag cau na ’inia.
Pani is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Pani很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: soni ia tarisinata tamna ’untukai. ’itumuru tia arumuana.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’una marisʉ’ʉsʉ’ʉrʉ, putaitairi, arapana’ʉ, musutatunu mataa purasini.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: matipa ku arapana’ʉ.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa arapana’ʉ ku, sutupuku! musucara’ʉ ’ʉvʉ maku.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nakai aratakarʉ ku, macuvungu arapana’ʉ!
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa makacʉkʉna ku, macangcangarʉ kavangvang cau!
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’apaco’e koo mara ta’uru-1, nakai macangcangarʉ ku. sii turupang ku arumuanʉ.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miʉra iku mataa cuma, rovʉvʉ na cuma vuravurau maku.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: musuvakʉrʉ ’acipi cuma vuravurau.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi kimia, ravi’a ucani tarako sua ’aruvu.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa mati’ʉnʉ’ʉna ’aruvu ia, aranai ’aruvu musurai.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: niarivici cuma ’aramʉ karavung mataa ’aviki movua cuma vuravurau.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: parʉ’ʉna ku mataa cuma vuravurau, pasovungu nguain ’itumuru ’ʉna.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa tia cu aratʉkʉnʉ, makasi cuma vuravurau, marʉngʉcai cu ku, marumanʉngʉ misee.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi ku, “noo manʉng cu ’acipi, ivataa kangvang na tanasa mia.”
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: 2022 cenana, makarikari sehu Yencumin tamna nipinsiu tʉni arisinatʉn Cau Vuvurung tamna nganai.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kesoniʉn maku miaranau cu makinee na sehu, nipinsiu tia marisinatʉ “caukia nganai” sua nanmarua puraku Pa’ʉ.
I interviewed Pa’ʉ, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Pa’ʉ。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’arupatuturu kim na tarasangara isi, tia mukusa tanasa in kesoni ’inia.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miaa kesoni ’inia, siukai nguain niaranai nanu sua nganai in. marivici pa ’ikua tarakanangʉ cau tanasa in, mataa nguain tamna puraku.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: kesoniʉn maku, miseni manatʉrʉ cʉpʉngʉ tia mati’ʉnʉ’ʉna nganai, cʉngnan niarisinatʉa ’esi nanu aka?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi ’ikua, ’urupaca Nakasayana ka’anʉ tʉni munasʉ sumasʉpʉrʉ nganai in. ’una pa cau marisusuna ’inia “巴先生” misee. ’itumuru makasua pacacaʉn.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35581/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「巴先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: makasi Pa’ʉ: “’urupaca Yencumin kari nganai ia, cucuru nganai mita. nganai maku ’esi ’inia cuku mita, cʉpʉngana mita, tina’an nganara mita, kamʉcʉ arakacaua cuakia tʉni mʉtʉa takacicini tamna nganai.”
Noami Kulas said, “The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group, our family, our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.”
我今天七點到學校。: Pa’ʉ說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: miʉra kipapa ku tamu nanakʉ mukusa tamia’aa mapupu’a. niarivici tamu ’itumuru tinakacicini mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ. kamanʉngʉ pa Cau Vuvurung tamna sa’o’o kʉkʉnʉa.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ka’anmanʉn cau tamu tamna tamia’aa. manman mataa ’arikuriki kacaua cau pu’a. kacaua kangvang cau kutanamʉ nipo’ucipia kee kʉkʉnʉa.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nipo’ucipia kee tariri mataa tipi cucuru sa’o’o, cinapa kee ’aramʉ vavuru, maricucu kacaua ’okiaku. matavʉnʉrʉ na ikim tamna tamia’aa.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有烤山豬肉煮，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: ’esiin po’icipi tamu, ’esi ku ciciri mariapa ’okiaku. marisusuna ku, “tinakacicini mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ, koo pucanumuʉn savuana, ivataa pu’a!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35581/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: nonoman mia makacang vangvangʉʉn cu mapu’a. makasi tamu, “vanai sii ’una kasu muranʉ.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: matacuvungu isi, takutavarʉ’ʉ ku poisua karukarua mataa kʉkʉnʉa macʉrʉng, takutavarʉ’ʉ pa cucuru mupacai sua mapu’a kasiupai.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata: cumacʉ’ʉra tamu masakʉn niurina kʉkʉnʉa, cucuru ku purangatʉ mataa ma’incu.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
